content.description: Climb the right leaning crack to a slopey topout.  If this is a duplicate or anyone knows the name, let me know.
content.protection: Pad.  Don't fall off the top.
content.location: Stay left through the first two trail forks (orange dotted trail on the extensions boulder map), and you'll see a tall arete left of the trail within 3 minutes of walking.

content.description:
Climb the left-trending arete from a sit down low in the leaves.  The sit is awkward (more awkward than difficult) if you only use the main block. 

  The quality of the route is not at all bad, but the fact that it is kind of on its own detracts from it.
content.protection: Pads but tricky to fully pad up.
content.location: Walk in and head down right to the swamp.  You should see a large flake propped against some other boulders.

pathTokens: Cavalry Boulder Field aka Gymnasium aka Playground

content.description: Easily - and for most part rightly - overlooked, these are a few boulders and slabs scattered around the 133 entrance to Cavalry.
